alert.note: Alert for Gray; Hodgeman; Lane; Ness; Scott; Trego (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 12:08AM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Kearny, Finney, Scott, western Ness, northwestern Hodgeman, southwestern Trego, Lane and northern Gray Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1207 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Healy to near Garden City. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Healy around 1220 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Pierceville, Dighton, Shields, Charleston, Pendennis, Cimarron, Ingalls and Alamota. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for southwestern and west central Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Gray; Hodgeman; Lane; Ness; Scott; Trego
